docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Pressure is building to revise Gramm-Rudman, the budget-balancing legislation enacted in 1985 and amended in 1987. Indeed, Congress seems to be on the verge of adopting a pattern of amending the law every two years. This year the argument for revising the targets will have a new and powerful twist: the need to protect people's retirement checks by segregating the Social Security accounts from the rest of the budget for deficit reduction purposes.
